revised_title: Osmotic Pressure and Molecular Interspaces in Aqueous Solutions
tldr: The authors discuss the concept of osmotic pressure and its relation to the molecular interspaces in aqueous solutions. They propose a theory that considers the complex nature of liquid water and how it affects the behavior of solutes in solution. The authors argue that the compression of a solution increases its internal vapour pressure, and they provide a mental picture to explain this phenomenon. They also explore the effects of temperature and pressure on osmotic pressure and discuss the limitations of current theories.
